result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Lee Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew Lee Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray appeared by video for Andrew Lee Davis.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received partial discovery material and has NOT received an offer from the State. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court in person for Andrew Lee Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Harris. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Andrew Lee Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  public defender/counsel representing defendant.  (Andrew L. Davis - #22007194, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis in Court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Andrew Lee Davis in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski on behalf of Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Mcmurray was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with TCW and any citizen witness mentioned in the criminal complaint or discovery material.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andrew Lee Davis in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Andrew Lee Davis in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
